description: Creates an image builder. An image builder is a virtual machine that is used to create an image. The initial state of the builder is PENDING. When it is ready, the state is RUNNING.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: A unique name for the image builder.

parameters.name: InstanceType
parameters.description: The instance type to use when launching the image builder. The following instance types are available: stream.standard.small stream.standard.medium stream.standard.large stream.compute.large stream.compute.xlarge stream.compute.2xlarge stream.compute.4xlarge stream.compute.8xlarge stream.memory.large stream.memory.xlarge stream.memory.2xlarge stream.memory.4xlarge stream.memory.8xlarge stream.memory.z1d.large stream.memory.z1d.xlarge stream.memory.z1d.2xlarge stream.memory.z1d.3xlarge stream.memory.z1d.6xlarge stream.memory.z1d.12xlarge stream.graphics-design.large stream.graphics-design.xlarge stream.graphics-design.2xlarge stream.graphics-design.4xlarge stream.graphics-desktop.2xlarge stream.graphics.g4dn.xlarge stream.graphics.g4dn.2xlarge stream.graphics.g4dn.4xlarge stream.graphics.g4dn.8xlarge stream.graphics.g4dn.12xlarge stream.graphics.g4dn.16xlarge stream.graphics-pro.4xlarge stream.graphics-pro.8xlarge stream.graphics-pro.16xlarge.

parameters.name: VpcConfig
parameters.description: The VPC configuration for the image builder. You can specify only one subnet. SubnetIds (list) --- The identifiers of the subnets to which a network interface is attached from the fleet instance or image builder instance. Fleet instances use one or more subnets. Image builder instances use one subnet. (string) --- SecurityGroupIds (list) --- The identifiers of the security groups for the fleet or image builder. (string) ---

nested_params.name: SubnetIds
nested_params.description: The identifiers of the subnets to which a network interface is attached from the fleet instance or image builder instance. Fleet instances use one or more subnets. Image builder instances use one subnet.

nested_params.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_params.description: The identifiers of the security groups for the fleet or image builder.

parameters.name: IamRoleArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to apply to the image builder. To assume a role, the image builder calls the AWS Security Token Service (STS) AssumeRole API operation and passes the ARN of the role to use. The operation creates a new session with temporary credentials. AppStream 2.0 retrieves the temporary credentials and creates the appstream_machine_role credential profile on the instance. For more information, see Using an IAM Role to Grant Permissions to Applications and Scripts Running on AppStream 2.0 Streaming Instances in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide.

parameters.name: DomainJoinInfo
parameters.description: The name of the directory and organizational unit (OU) to use to join the image builder to a Microsoft Active Directory domain. DirectoryName (string) --- The fully qualified name of the directory (for example, corp.example.com). OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedName (string) --- The distinguished name of the organizational unit for computer accounts.

nested_params.name: DirectoryName
nested_params.description: The fully qualified name of the directory (for example, corp.example.com).

nested_params.name: OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedName
nested_params.description: The distinguished name of the organizational unit for computer accounts.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to associate with the image builder. A tag is a key-value pair, and the value is optional. For example, Environment=Test. If you do not specify a value, Environment=. Generally allowed characters are: letters, numbers, and spaces representable in UTF-8, and the following special characters: _ . : / = + - @ If you do not specify a value, the value is set to an empty string. For more information about tags, see Tagging Your Resources in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: AccessEndpoints
parameters.description: The list of interface VPC endpoint (interface endpoint) objects. Administrators can connect to the image builder only through the specified endpoints. (dict) --- Describes an interface VPC endpoint (interface endpoint) that lets you create a private connection between the virtual private cloud (VPC) that you specify and AppStream 2.0. When you specify an interface endpoint for a stack, users of the stack can connect to AppStream 2.0 only through that endpoint. When you specify an interface endpoint for an image builder, administrators can connect to the image builder only through that endpoint. The type of interface endpoint. VpceId (string) --- The identifier (ID) of the VPC in which the interface endpoint is used.

nested_params.name: VpceId
nested_params.description: The identifier (ID) of the VPC in which the interface endpoint is used.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the image builder.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The ARN for the image builder.

nested_items.name: ImageArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the image from which this builder was created.

nested_items.name: DisplayName
nested_items.description: The image builder name to display.

nested_items.name: VpcConfig
nested_items.description: The VPC configuration of the image builder.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: The identifiers of the subnets to which a network interface is attached from the fleet instance or image builder instance. Fleet instances use one or more subnets. Image builder instances use one subnet.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The identifiers of the security groups for the fleet or image builder.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type for the image builder. The following instance types are available:

nested_items.name: Platform
nested_items.description: The operating system platform of the image builder.

nested_items.name: IamRoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that is applied to the image builder. To assume a role, the image builder calls the AWS Security Token Service (STS) AssumeRole API operation and passes the ARN of the role to use. The operation creates a new session with temporary credentials. AppStream 2.0 retrieves the temporary credentials and creates the appstream_machine_role credential profile on the instance.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the image builder.

nested_items.name: StateChangeReason
nested_items.description: The reason why the last state change occurred.

nested_items.name: CreatedTime
nested_items.description: The time stamp when the image builder was created.

nested_items.name: EnableDefaultInternetAccess
nested_items.description: Enables or disables default internet access for the image builder.

nested_items.name: DomainJoinInfo
nested_items.description: The name of the directory and organizational unit (OU) to use to join the image builder to a Microsoft Active Directory domain.

nested_items.name: DirectoryName
nested_items.description: The fully qualified name of the directory (for example, corp.example.com).

nested_items.name: OrganizationalUnitDistinguishedName
nested_items.description: The distinguished name of the organizational unit for computer accounts.

nested_items.name: NetworkAccessConfiguration
nested_items.description: Describes the network details of the fleet or image builder instance.

nested_items.name: EniPrivateIpAddress
nested_items.description: The private IP address of the elastic network interface that is attached to instances in your VPC.

nested_items.name: EniId
nested_items.description: The resource identifier of the elastic network interface that is attached to instances in your VPC. All network interfaces have the eni-xxxxxxxx resource identifier.

nested_items.name: AppstreamAgentVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the AppStream 2.0 agent that is currently being used by the image builder.

nested_items.name: AccessEndpoints
nested_items.description: The list of virtual private cloud (VPC) interface endpoint objects. Administrators can connect to the image builder only through the specified endpoints.

nested_items.name: VpceId
nested_items.description: The identifier (ID) of the VPC in which the interface endpoint is used.

nested_items.name: LatestAppstreamAgentVersion
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the image builder is using the latest AppStream 2.0 agent version or not.
